function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate outdoor air supply leading to poor ventilation and increased risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne disease transmission and compromised indoor air quality.","Mitigation":"Increase the amount of outdoor air supply and utilize 100% outdoor air when possible. Utilize technology to monitor and control outdoor air supply.","Technologies":"Outdoor air dampers, ventilation control systems.","People":"Building occupants, especially in densely populated or poorly ventilated spaces.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, HVAC technicians."},{"Description":"Inadequate operation of HVAC systems leading to poor ventilation and increased risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne disease transmission and compromised indoor air quality.","Mitigation":"Operate HVAC systems for extended periods, utilize ventilation at nominal speed, and implement demand-controlled ventilation systems.","Technologies":"Ventilation control systems, demand-controlled ventilation (DCV) systems.","People":"Building occupants, especially in densely populated or poorly ventilated spaces.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, HVAC technicians."},{"Description":"Inappropriate temperature and humidity setpoints leading to discomfort and potential health risks.","Impact":"Increased discomfort for occupants and potential negative impact on health and well-being.","Mitigation":"Implement appropriate temperature and humidity setpoints based on guidelines, considering case-by-case needs.","Technologies":"Building management systems, temperature and humidity sensors.","People":"Building occupants, especially those sensitive to temperature and humidity fluctuations.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, HVAC technicians."},{"Description":"Inadequate pressure differential leading to potential for cross-contamination of air between safe and unsafe areas.","Impact":"Increased risk of cross-contamination and potential spread of airborne pathogens between different areas within a building.","Mitigation":"Ensure proper airflow direction from safe to unsafe areas, and from personal use areas to public areas. Utilize technology to monitor and maintain pressure differentials.","Technologies":"Pressure sensors, airflow control systems.","People":"Occupants in buildings with varying degrees of air pressure differentials, particularly in healthcare and laboratory settings.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, HVAC technicians."}]}
